titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Workingmen's Co-operative Publishing Association Records TAM.035
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-09-09T17:20-0400

change.item: Edited by Maggie Schreiner to reflect updated administrative information

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: The Workingmen’s Cooperative Publishing Association was a socialist organization affiliated with the Socialist Party of New York, and the governing board of New York Call, a socialist daily newspaper, published between 1908 and 1923, which was eventually prohibited from second-class mailing status by the Postmaster General of the United States for violating provisions of the Espionage Law in 1917. The collection consists of correspondence, by-laws, organizational papers and membership lists, and some printed material created by the Association and other Socialist organizations. The material largely relates to pubishing business matters, fund raising schemes, and staff and editorial difficulties. Most of the correspondence is that of financial secretary Julius Gerber. Other correspondents include W. J. Ghent and Algernon Lee.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Workingmen’s Cooperative Publishing Association was a socialist organization affiliated with the Socialist Party of New York, and the governing board of New York Call, a socialist daily newspaper, published between 1908 and 1923 (also known as the ). The was eventually prohibited from second-class mailing status by the Postmaster General of the United States for violating provisions of the Espionage Law in 1917.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This partially processed collection is arranged as follows: correspondence, printed matter, miscellaneous, constitution and membership lists.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection are in the public domain. Users need not secure permission from the Tamiment Library to publish or reproduce materials in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection primarily consists of correspondence, by-laws, organizational papers and membership lists created by the Association. There is also some printed material created by the Association and other Socialist organizations. The documents span from 1908 to 1920. The material largely relates to business matters concerning the publication of the New York Call, fund raising schemes, and staff and editorial difficulties. Most of the correspondence is that of financial secretary Julius Gerber. Other correspondents include S. John Block, W. J. Ghent, Ben Hanford and Algernon Lee.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Workingmen's Co-operative Publishing Association Records; TAM 035; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accesion number 1950.097 is associated with this collection.

did.unittitle: Correspondence (Part 2), Printed Matter, Miscellaneous, Constitution and Membership Lists
